page.title: 09Shopping in Strensall.
page.content: Strensall shops in 1985:Grocers (3), Butchers, Post Office, Newsagents, Ladies and childrens clothes, Antiques Ladies hairdresser, Fish and chips, Cafe shop opposite Strensall camp. Shop owners/ managers consider people use the village grocers for 'bits and pieces'during the week.Most people buy the bulk of their groceries from big stores near York.A free bus service operated by the ASDA store takes trade from the shops. Butter, bread, milk, pets food,fruit and vegetables, wines and spirits are the most popular items.The shops serve{local needs.}One grocer{opens Sundays}when other shops are closed.The butcher supplies many bulk orders of meat for home freezers. Beef is the most popular meat. Most used shops: grocers,butchers,post office,fish & chips. People said they wanted a chemists and a hardware shop.
